abstract: A strike at a crucial parts factory is the clearest sign yet of growing labor unrest in a country at the cornerstone of companies’ global supply chains.
snippet: A strike at a crucial parts factory is the clearest sign yet of growing labor unrest in a country at the cornerstone of companies’ global supply chains.
lead_paragraph: HONG KONG  A strike at a crucial parts factory has forced Honda to shut down all four of its joint venture assembly plants in China. It was the clearest sign yet of growing labor unrest in a country that now stands at the cornerstone of companies’ global supply chains.

headline.main: Strike Forces Honda to Shut Plants in China
headline.print_headline: Parts Strike Forces a Honda Shutdown in China

abstract: Cheap stocks and robust consumption by its middle class are reason to buy into China now, even though markets have turned cautious on the world’s No.3 economy, a fund manager at BlackRock told Reuters.
snippet: Cheap stocks and robust consumption by its middle class are reason to buy into China now, even though markets have turned cautious on the world’s No.3 economy, a fund manager at BlackRock told Reuters.
lead_paragraph: Cheap stocks and robust consumption by its middle class are reason to buy into China now, even though markets have turned cautious on the nation, a fund manager at BlackRock told Reuters.

headline.main: China Remains Good Buy, BlackRock Says
